item.title: CoD: Black Ops 6 And Warzone Update Buffs D1.3 Sector And Extends TMNT Event
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/cod-black-ops-6-and-warzone-update-buffs-d1-3-sector-and-extends-tmnt-event/1100-6530049/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

A small update has arrived to Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 And Warzone on March 11, and the patch notes reveal a buff for Season 2 Reloaded's new D1.3 Sector special weapon. Call of Duty's TMNT event has also received an extension, so players now have more time to earn those Ninja Turtle rewards.

Call of Duty: Warzone - Unforgettable Verdansk Teaser Trailer

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles crossover event was originally scheduled to end on March 13, but players now have until March 20 to complete the TMNT event pass.

The season's new D1.3 Sector special weapon is adjusted for both Black Ops 6 and Warzone. This includes a buff that affects the weapon's ricochet blade ammo type, which increases the damage from 75 to 100. The developer says the change was made to make the blades a one-hit kill, but that the rate of fire and projectile velocity were decreased to compensate for the more powerful blades. Additionally, the ricochet blades also now have improved bouncing speeds and physics.

For Zombies, the patch notes address an issue with the Citadelle des Morts boss fight that previously allowed The Guardian to bypass Dying Wish and the downed state when attacking.

On the Warzone side, the patch notes include an adjustment specifically for MW2 and MW3 melee weapons. This change allows the weapons to have the same Tac-Sprint speeds as Black Ops 6's melee weapons.

The full patch notes can be found below for both Black Ops 6 and Warzone, as shared by Activision.

While this was just a small update for Call of Duty, a much bigger update is planned for next month. Warzone's original Verdansk map returns on April 3. This will likely include the full Season 3 update for Black Ops 6 and Warzone, but Activision hasn't revealed any further details yet.

GLOBAL

Events

TMNT Event

  • Adjusted the end date to March 20th at 10 AM PT.

Weapons: BO6 Multiplayer & Zombies

D1.3 Sector

Our initial design for the D1.3 Sector Ricochet Blades revolved around quickly launching many high-speed blades, meant to perform best blind firing into enclosed spaces. We have been following your feedback and agree that, in practice, the use cases for this ammo type are too low. The Ricochet Blades will now do 100 damage to enable one-hit kills, and to compensate we are lowering the fire rate and projectile speed. We think the popularity of this ammo type will see some new interest with these changes and look forward to seeing more of your cross-map killcams in MP.

  • Ricochet Blades
    • Increased damage from 75 to 100.
    • Decreased rate of fire.
    • Decreased projectile velocity.
    • Improved bouncing speeds and physics.

Gunsmith

  • Addressed an issue that prevented the Gunsmith from being accessible while in a match. (Added March 3)

MULTIPLAYER

Maps

  • Bullet
    • The sliding doors will no longer open when shot. (Added March 3)

Modes

  • Private Match
    • Infected
      • Addressed an issue with spawns and re-enabled the game mode in Private Matches.

Perks

  • Tracker
    • Removed the unintentional outline effect when ADS pinging enemies. (Added March 3)

Challenges

  • D1.3 Sector
    • Addressed an issue that would prevent the “Fast Times” Camo Challenge from tracking.

UI

  • Tracked and Near Completion Challenges are now sorted by completion percentage. (Added on March 3)

ZOMBIES

Maps

  • Citadelle des Morts
    • Addressed an issue where The Guardian could sometimes bypass Dying Wish and the downed state when attacking.

Weapons

  • Addressed an issue that prevented the Overheat meter from displaying when using the Belt Fed LMG Magazine attachment.
    • Known Issue: The Overheat meter UI will appear when equipping the Beamsmasher Wonder Weapon and will be removed in a subsequent update.

WARZONE

  • TMNT Event
    • Adjusted the end date to March 20th at 10 AM PT.

WEAPONS

» SMGs «

  • Superi 46
    • Bore 99 Short Barrel
      • Sprint Speed Benefit Reduced from 8% to 4%
    • Rescue-9 Stock
      • Sprint Speed Benefit Reduced from 8% to 4%

» Melee «

  • MW2 and MW3 Melee Weapons
    • Tac Sprint speeds now match Black Ops 6 Tac Sprint speeds

» Special «

  • D1.3 Sector
    • Ricochet Blades
      • Increased damage from 75 to 100.
      • Decreased rate of fire.
      • Decreased projectile velocity.
      • Improved bouncing speeds and physics.

item.title: Crocs Are Coming To Fortnite So You Can Ensure Foot Comfort For Optimus Prime
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/crocs-are-coming-to-fortnite-so-you-can-ensure-foot-comfort-for-optimus-prime/1100-6530045/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Forget the back bling and iconic skins. Is your character comfortable enough in Fortnite? Because if not, the battle-royale game has teased Crocs are coming with the latest update. For those unfamiliar, they're a popular brand of clogs and sandals that can be decorated with charms.

On YouTube, a new trailer for Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 2 showcases the return of the limited-time Getaway mode. At the end, Outlaw Midas is seen sporting Crocs on their feet. Additionally, a Fortnite leaker named SpushFNBR on X claims the shoe cosmetics could drop as soon as today, March 11, with the classic Crocs in white and pink costing 1,000 V-Bucks. Meanwhile, the Echo Wave and Echo Marbled variations will reportedly be 800 V-Bucks each.

Fortnite Kicks were introduced to the game in November with Nike shoes and Air Jordans. Developer Epic Games also creates wholly original shoes, such as the Chomp Stomp slippers. The plan has been for Fortnite Kicks to work with roughly 95% of skins before spring, which begins March 20 in North America.

Earlier this week, three-time MLB MVP Shohei Ohtani was revealed as the latest addition for the Fortnite Icon Series. The Los Angeles Dodgers star will become available March 17, with 17 also being his jersey number. Ohtani is the first MLB player to get a Fortnite skin.

As for Crocs, this isn't the first time the brand has partnered with video games. For example, last year saw the introduction of Pokemon Crocs, including one focused on Snorlax. There also have been Batmobile Crocs in the past.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Katamari Damacy Rolls On With Its First New Game In 8 Years
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/katamari-damacy-rolls-on-with-its-first-new-game-in-8-years/1100-6530047/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

After almost a decade, Katamari is back with Katamari Damacy Rolling Live, which launches exclusively on Apple Arcade. Five other games are joining Katamari starting April 3: Space Invaders Infinity Gene Evolve, Puffies, Atari's RollerCoaster Tycoon Classic+, The Game of Life 2+, and Sesame Street Mecha Builders+. All games are free of ads and in-app purchases.

Like other installments of the franchise, Katamari Damacy Rolling Live has players roll the Katamari as ordered by the King of All Cosmos to gather objects in a giant, chaotic ball to fill the sky with stars. This time around, it incorporates a "streaming" aspect.

Now, players have to energize the king's "livestream" by rolling their Katamari to create stars once more. As the game goes on, in-game fans appear in the "comment section," and the longer they play, the larger their audience grows. Players advance the game by completing the king’s challenges and boosting their subscriber count.

After a moderate success in Japan, the Katamari Damacy series became a cult classic and one of the top-rated games back in 2004. The sequels We Love Katamari and Me And My Katamari were released a year later, on the PlayStation 2 and PlayStation Portable, respectively.

The last entry in the franchise was Katamari Damacy Reroll, a remake of the 2004 classic. Originally released for the Nintendo Switch in late 2018, the game eventually made its way to PlayStation and Xbox in 2020.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
